Values: Journal of the American Chemical Society
Yes, the supporting information is available free of charge on the ACS Publications website at DOI: 10.1021/jacs.7b05683.

Excitation wavelength (λ_exc): 460 nm
Emission wavelength (λ_exc): 350 nm

1. Photoluminescence Quantum Yield (PL QY) measurements
2. Time-Correlated Single Photon Counting Time-Resolved Emission Spectroscopy (TCSPC-TRES)
3. Solvatochromism measurements
4. Excitation Intensity-Dependent Emission measurements
5. Powder X-ray Diffraction (XRD) measurements
6. Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM)
7. Absorption Spectroscopy
8. Photoluminescence (PL) and Photoluminescence Excitation (PLE) Spectroscopy
The PL quantum yields (QY) of the halide perovskite mentioned range from 30 to 60%.
